intro: Streptanthus glandulosus var. sonomensis, commonly known as the Sonoma bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as chaparral and grasslands. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial, with hairy stems and pinnately divided leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
